column7: active verb suffixes would have indicated primitive pronouns for agents and forces in a VS language
active verb suffixes would have indicated primitive pronouns for patients and themes in a VS language
nominative pronouns came as a later development, or more accurately,
the verb suffixes stood as nominative pronouns in an early form of the language
accusative singular suffix would have indicated particles for patients and themes
nominative singular suffix would have indicated particles for agents
vocative singular would have reflected the root of the word
inanimate singular suffixes would have indicated particles for patients and themes, since they could never be agents
